column4: Addicting Infoprovides a blend of news geared towardliberals along with research intensive articles meant to debunk conservative myths. With that said they do have a strong left wing bias in reporting and they do not hide it. They occasionally publish satire that may be misleading to some. Has some questionable claims.(5/13/2016) Updated (4/4/2017)

The Advocate is an American LGBT-interest magazine; printed bi-monthlyand available by subscription. The Advocate brand also includes a website. Both magazine and website have an editorial focus on news; politics; opinion; and arts and entertainment of interest to lesbians; gay men; bisexuals and transgender (LGBT) people.The Advocate has left leaning political bias in reporting and subject matter. Does not use a lot of loaded words and is usually factual and well sourced. (8/23/2016)

All Thats Fab is a news and opinion website with astrong left bias in reporting. ATFuses sensational headlines that do not always match the content of the articles.While All Thats Fab does usually provide sources to back their articles; the bias through wording presented within them can be misleading; therefore we give this source a mixed rating for factual reporting. (12/31/2016)

AlterNet is a liberal activist news service and a project of the non-profit Independent Media Institute thatLaunched in 1998. AlterNet has very strong left wing bias through report choices and strongly worded headlines. Some articles are sourced to other biased sources and may need a fact check. AlterNet is listed on the Fort Liberty hoax website list. We wouldnt go so far as to call this a hoax website; but some articles are certainly questionable. (5/13/2016)

Amandla! is a South African bi-monthly magazine that was launched in 2006.The founders are Mazibuko K. Jara; and Brian Ashley.The magazine is published by the Alternative Information and Development Centre (AIDC) and provides coverage and analysis of current political; economic and social processes from a radical left perspective. (8/16/2016)

AMERICAblog is a liberal American blog founded by John Aravosis in April 2004; with several co-bloggers. AmericaBlog uses moderately strong loaded words and somewhat sensational headlines; however most news is consistently factual and well sourced. (11/11/2016)

American Bridge 21st Century is a liberal American Super PAC that supports Democratic candidates and opposes Republican candidates.It was founded by David Brock in 2010 and is associated with Media Matters for America. It is an opposition research hub for the Democratic Party.The group physically tracks and monitors Republican candidates and officials and uses social media to deploy its findings. This source uses loaded words to describe Republicans and does not always source claims. Has a mixed rating with Politifact. (1/24/2017)

American News Xis a website that features news; op-eds and satire. All of which are categorized and labeled as such. News and Op-eds are presented with a left wing bias in wording and story selection. Most news is well sourced; but occasionally is linked to other left biased sources. (11/21/2016)

Backed by Fact is a news and opinion blog that sources well. However; they do tend to source to left leaning information and they do use loaded words when describing conservatives. An example of this loaded language can be seen in this sensational headline:Bidens Next Move Is Going to Piss Off Trump. (1/31/2017)

The Bay Area Reporter is a free weekly newspaper serving the LGBT communities in the San Francisco Bay Area; it is one of the largest circulation LGBT newspapers by circulation in the United States and the countrys oldest continuously published newspaper of its kind. Well written and well sourced. Has a liberal political bias in story selection. (10/16/2016)

Bitch Media is a non-profit multimedia organization based in Portland; Oregon. It is best known for producing Bitch (magazine); a quarterly publication with the tagline A feminist response to pop culture. Founded in 1996 by Andi Zeisler and Lisa Jervis; Bitch Media has grown to encompass several podcasts; a fellowship for up-and-coming writers; and a community lending library. Bitch Media has a left wing bias in story selection and political affiliation through the promotion of Feminist causes. All information is sourced accurately and is credible. There is only minimal use of loaded words in headlines and articles. This is a solid source for feminist information. (4/2/2017)

Black Agenda Report is a news and opinion website and radio program. The articles are well written and in general factually accurate. The site does have a clear left wing political bias through story selection and some wording. (11/28/2016)

Black Lives Matter (BLM) is an international activist movement; originating in the African-American community; that campaigns against violence and systemic racism toward black people. BLM regularly protests police killings of black people and broader issues of racial profiling; police brutality; and racial inequality in the United States criminal justice system. BLM currently has a clean record with fact checkers. (11/14/2016)

The Blue Dot Daily is a news and opinion blog that sometimes uses sensational headlines to report current news with a clear left bias; but they do openly state that they are not a news media source; but rather a blog. Bottom line: Extreme left bias in wording and relatively factual reporting (F. Locke-Siewert 12/30/2016).

Blue Nation Review is now called Share Blue. This source is owned by David Brock; apolitical operative of the Hillary Clinton Campaign. During the election this source only published Pro-Clinton content or negative reports on her opponents. After the election the source is publishing a highly one sided viewpoint that favors liberals. (5/13/2016) Updated (4/4/2017)

Boing Boing is a website; first established as a zine in 1988; later becoming a group blog. Common themes include technology; futurism; science fiction; gadgets; intellectual property; Disney and left-wing politics. Though left leaning in bias this source is generally reliable for factual content that is sourced properly. (11/25/2016)

Breitbart Unmasked is a news and opinion website with a very strong left wing bias. Articles and headlines contain numerous loaded emotional words that favor the left and criticize the right. Breitbart Unmasked typically takes quotes from other left biased articles and then applies commentary to it. The commentary is always left biased. Based on sourcing to other left wing sites that may have a mixed factual rating we are also rating Breitbart Unmasked as mixed. (5/17/2017)

BUST Magazine is a womens lifestyle magazine that is published six times a year. BUST covers music; news; crafts; art; sex; and fashion from an independent (indie); third wave feminist perspective. BUST has a left leaning bias in story selection and political affiliation. There is minimal use of loaded language and most articles are well sourced to reliable information. (11/23/2016)

Described as a magazine for people who want to change the world; Canadian Dimension is a forum for left-wing political thought that ranges from New Democratic Party-style social democracy to libertarian socialism. Very strong evidence based journalism; but clearly biased in presentation. (8/16/2016) Updated (2/24/17)

Carbonated TV is a news and opinion website that relies on video for news reporting. Carbonated TV has a strong left wing bias in reporting through the use of emotive words and story selection. They do however source their information back to reasonable sources. (2/8/2017)

The Center for American Progress (CAP) is a progressive public policy research and advocacy organizationfounded by John Podesta who was Chairman of the Hillary Clinton 2016 campaign. CAPs reporting typical favors establishment progressive issues which results in aliberal bias with report selection. We are unable to find any false fact checks and therefore rate CAP as high for factual reporting. (5/13/2016)

The Center for Media and Democracy (CMD) is a non-partisan progressive watchdog group led by Lisa Graves. CMD manages this website; SourceWatch.org. As noted on SourceWatchs sister site; PRWatch.org; CMD strengthens participatory democracy by investigating and exposing public relations spin and propaganda such as corporate greenwashing; and by promoting media literacy and citizen journalism. CMD also manages the BanksterUSA website. CMD was founded in 1993 by John Stauber. Some contend that CMD is not neutral. CMD has been criticized for having an anti-corporate viewpoint. CMD clearly has left wing bias in reporting; but there isnt evidence of any false claims made by this group. (8/15/2017) Updated (4/20/2017)

Change.org is a petition website operated by Change.org; Inc.; an American certified B corporation which claims to have over 100 million usersand hosts sponsored campaigns for organizations. Popular topics of Change.org petitions are economic and criminal justice; human rights; education; environmental protection; animals rights; health; and sustainable food. Change has a left wing bias through the political issues it supports. (11/14/2016)

The Chicago Reader is an American alternative weekly newspaper in Chicago; Illinois; noted for its literary style of journalism and coverage of the arts; particularly film and theater. The Chicago Reader has a left wing bias in story selection and political affiliation. There is minimal use of loaded language and most information is properly sourced. (8/19/2016)

Chronicles of Democracy is a news and opinion website with a liberal bias in reporting choices. There is moderate use of loaded words that favor the left and discredit the right; however most articles are well sourced to credible outlets. Despite the leftward bias this source reports factually. (2/28/2017)

The Cable News Network (CNN) is an American basic cable and satellite television channel that is owned by the Turner Broadcasting System division of Time Warner. It was founded in 1980 by American media proprietor Ted Turner as a 24-hour cable news channel;however; by April 2016; a CNN executive officially described the channel as no longer a TV news network and instead as a 24-hour global multi-platform network. CNN has a left bias in reporting and sometimes uses sensational headlines. CNN typically sources its news sources. Do not confuse CNNs talk shows with actual reporting of news. Further; they have failed numerous fact checks from Politifact. (5/16/2016) Updated (6/4/2017)

Common Dreams; is a 501(c)3 nonprofit U.S.-based progressive news website. Common Dreams publishes news stories; editorials and a newswire of current breaking news. Common Dreams also re-publishes relevant content from numerous other sources such as the Associated Press.The website also provides links to other relevant columnists; periodicals; radio outlets; news services; and websites. Overall; Common Dreams produces solid journalism and sources their information well. The only fault is they sometimes source other to far left sources rather more neutral ones. (5/13/2016) Updated (4/20/2017)

Cosmopolitan is an international fashion magazine for womenand has a circulation of over 3 million. Cosmos primary focus is on fashion; sex and relationship tips; but they also cover politics. Cosmo has a strong left wing bias in reporting and story selection. Though biased; Cosmo usually publishes sourced information. (11/21/2016)

CounterCurrents.org is a news and opinion website based in India. CC has a left wing political bias based on environmental/economic positions and a negative view toward American conservatives. CC uses some loaded words; but usually sources to credible information. Therefore; we rate them left for bias and high factual for reporting. (6/6/2017)

CounterPunch is a bi-monthly magazine published in the United States that covers politics in a manner its editors describe as muckraking with a radical attitude.It has been described as left-wing by both supporters and detractors. CounterPunch provides excellent journalism and sources their information. As indicated they have a left wing bias politically and they run a lot opinion type pieces which they also properly indicate. (5/13/2016) Updated (4/20/2017)

CrimethInc.also known as CWC; which stands for either CrimethInc. Ex-Workers Collective is a decentralized anarchist collective of autonomous cells.CrimethInc. emerged in the mid-1990s;initially as the hardcore zine Inside Front; and began operating as a collective in 1996.It has since published widely read articles and zines for the anarchist movement and distributed posters and books of its own publication. We rate CrimethInc. left biased based on their political opposition to capitalism and advocacy for workers. These political positions are considered left wing in todays political environment. CWC does use occasional emotional language; but all information is well sourced and linked to facts. (5/7/2017)

Crooks and Liars is a progressive news blog focusing on political events and the news coverage of them.For the most part Crooks and Liarssources properly; but at times they are very sensational with the use of strongly loaded emotional wording that discredits conservatives. They rarely cover both sides of a story and often source to other left wing sources rather than finding more neutral sourcing. (5/13/2016) Updated (4/20/2017)

Current Affairs is a magazine that publishes bi-monthly in print and online. It was started by Nathan J. Robinson; a PhD student at Harvard Universityin 2015 via a kickstarter campaign. Its stated aims are to be an informative and entertaining independent publication. Current affairs covers politics and culture with a left wing bias in topical story selection. They do however source their information well and tend to be factual. (12/15/2016)

The Daily Beast is an American news reporting and opinion website focusing on politics and pop culture. The Daily Beast has been accused of biased reporting favoring Hillary Clinton during the 2016 election. The Daily Beast tends to sensationalize headlines; but they do typically source the info in their reports. (5/13/2016) Updated (2/24/2017)

The Daily Dot is a digital media company covering Internet culture and life on the web. The Daily Dot has moderate left wing political bias in reporting choices and typically does not use excessive loaded words. This is a reliable source that leans left. (5/13/2016) Updated (3/24/2017)

Daily Kos is an outlet for Political Blogging. It functions as a discussion forum and group blog for a variety of netroots activists whose efforts are primarily directed toward influencing and strengthening progressive policies and candidates. Daily Kos has many different writers and therefore it is unpredictable in bias and factual reliability. It is up to the reader to fact check these writers and to look for good sourcing in each article. (5/13/2016) Updated (4/21/2017)

The Daily Mirror is a British national daily tabloid newspaper founded in 1903. The Daily Mirror is not known for high journalism. It is a sensationalized tabloid with very bold headlines and little substance. It sometimes is not factual. (5/13/2016)

The Daily News Bin is a web based news and politics website. It has a strong left wing bias through report choices that favors the leftand uses strong loaded words in headlines and reports. For example; on December 14; 2016 there is an Op-Edwith the headline: Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump are simply anti-American terrorists. The use of the words anti-American terrorists is a classic use of loaded words to entice clicks. According toWeb of Trustthe Daily News Bin has been flagged for trustworthiness based on misleading claims and being unethical.Snopeshas rated three stories as false in 2016. According to our user ratings; Daily News Bin has been rated as Extreme Left biased 76% of the time. When reporting news the Daily News Bin uses mostly neutral headlines and sources information to credible media. The problem with Daily News Bin is their over-the-top political bias on opinion pieces; overshadows their often excellentjournalism in news reporting.

Dallas Voice; founded in 1984; is a newspaper for the gay community in Dallas; Texas (USA). The Dallas Voice demonstrates left wing bias throughreport choices and wording. They consistently source their information properly. (10/7/2016)

Dead State is an online news and opinion website with a strong left wing biasthrough the use of loaded words; attention grabbing headlines and story selection. Within the actual articles you find well sourced information that tends to come fromreputable left-center and left sources. Dead State is clearly a left leaning news source; but backs up reports with credible sourcing. (12/6/2016) Updated (2/24/2017)

Democracy Now! is an hour-long American TV; radio and internet news program hosted by Progressive journalists Amy Goodman and Juan Gonzalez.The show; which airs live each weekday at 08:00 ET; is broadcast on the internet and by nearly 1;400 radio and television stations worldwide. Demonstrates typical left wingbias via editorialopinions; but reports news factually. (10/12/2016)

Democratic Underground; also known as DU; is an online community for U.S. Democrats. Its membership is restricted by policy to those who are supportive of the Democratic Party and Democratic candidates for political office. DU has a strong left wing bias due to all members being sworn democrats. Factual reporting is mixed based on the person and their sourcing. (5/13/2016) Updated (4/21/2017)

The DeSmogBlog; founded in January 2006; is a blog that focuses on topics related to global warming. The site describes itself as the worlds number one source for accurate; fact based information regarding Global Warming misinformation campaigns.DeSmogBlog opposes what it describes as a well-funded and highly organized public relations campaign that it says is poisoning the climate change debate. DeSmog provides news regarding policy and corporate actions against climate science. They alsohave a list on their website that shows individual climate change deniers as well as groups such as the Heartland Institute. While Desmog sources to credible scientific information we rate this source left biased based on its political stance regarding climate change. This is an excellent source for researching who is funding climate science denial. (5/11/2017)

Die Hard Democrat is a news and opinion website/blog that has a left bias in reporting. In reviewing articles 10 out of 10 articles favored the left and criticized the right. There is mild to moderate use of loaded words to convey emotion for or against the topic of articles. Die Hard Democrat does a good job of sourcing their information and for the most part their sources are left and left-center media outlets. We rate this website high for factual reporting based on proper sourcing and mild use of loaded language and left biased based on reporting from only one side. Additional note; this source does not have an about page to describe their mission; which limits their credibility. (5/20/2017) Updated (7/22/2017)

Dissent is a quarterly; left-wing journal focusing on politics and culture edited by Michael Kazin and David Marcus. The journal is published by the University of Pennsylvania Press on behalf of the Foundation for the Study of Independent Social Ideas; Inc. Dissent has a left wing bias in story selection and minimally through wording. Most information is properly sourced to credible information. (5/13/2016)

The Drudge Retort was created as a left leaning parody of the Drudge Report. The site was designed in a similar style and releases news in a similar way. The difference is the Drudge Retort is left biased. (11/25/2016)

Earth First! is a radical environmental advocacy groupthat emerged in the Southwestern United States in 1979. Earth First was the group responsible to tree spiking in the late 80s and early 90s that resulted in an injury when a saw blade shattered. Earth First continues to use sabotage tactics to protect the earth; however; they now have a policy of making sure humans will not be injured. The content of the journal is extreme left environmental activism and anti-capitalism. We could not find an instance of failed fact check; but we did note that they do not support the consensus of science when it comes to GMOs. Based on that we are rating them mixed for factual reporting. (5/8/2017)

Economy In Crisis; INC (EconomyInCrisis.org) is a non-profit corporation dedicated to educating legislators and the American public on the destruction of our countrys industrial base. Demonstratestypical left bias in reporting; but is weak on science and dabbles in left wing conspiracies. (8/15/2016)

Electronic Intifada is a news publication and educational resource focusing on Palestine; its people; politics; culture and place in theworld. Electronic Intifada has a very strong Pro-Palestinian bias in report choices and does not always cover both sides of the story. However; they are mostly factual in reporting due to proper sourcing to credible information. (D. Van Zandt 5/13/2016)

Elisabeth Parker is a news and opinion blog written by we assume; Elisabeth Parker. We question this because the about page does not seem to exist. Regardless of who is writing this blog it has a very strong left wing bias in both the use of loaded emotional words and story selection. While this site is clearly biased in what and how it chooses to publish; it is also very well sourced using credible news and information outlets. This blog is highly biased; but grounded in fact. (4/7/2017)

Elite Daily is an American online news platform. Self-described as Millennials preferred platform for todays hot issues and trending topics; its slogan is The Voice of Generation Y. In addition to general news; the site offers feature stories and listicles in the areas of politics; social justice; sex and dating; college life; womens issues; money; sports; and humor. Elite Daily publishes mostly entertainment and lifestyle news; but they do cover politics also. They have a left bias in reporting and wording. Elite Daily occasionally publishes a misleading orpoorly sourced article. (12/13/2016)

Esquire is an American mens magazine; published by the Hearst Corporation in the United Statesthat was founded in 1933. Covers a wide variety of topics including entertainment; fashion and politics. Politically; Esquire has a typical left wing bias. Has a fleet of editors to ensure they are factual and correct mistakes. (11/3/2016)

Everyday Feminism is afeminist online educational platform that features articles on gender; race; religion; sex; health; and class. It has a stated mission to help dismantle violence; discrimination; and marginalization. (11/21/2016)
Evonomics is a progressive website that focuses on mostly progressive economics. While the bias is pretty strong against capitalism they do source well to mostly credible sources. (2/14/2017)

Fifth Estate (FE) is a U.S. periodical; based in Detroit; Michigan; begun in 1965; but with staff members across North America who connect via the Internet. Its editorial collective sometimes has divergent views on the topics the magazine addresses but generally shares anarchist; anti-authoritarian outlook and a non-dogmatic; action-oriented approach to change.We rate Fifth Estateleft biased based on their political opposition to capitalism and environmental activism. These political positions are considered left wing in todays political environment. FE does use occasional emotional language; but all information is well sourced and linked to facts. (5/7/2017)

According to the Filming Cops About Page they were started in 2010 as a conglomerative reporting service documenting police abuse. They state that the aim isnt to demonize the natural concept of security provision as such; but to highlight specific cases of State-monopolized police brutality that are otherwise ignored by traditional media outlets. Although Filming Cops does what it claims; it is 100% one sided and therefore extremely biased against police. It does however; publish real footage; it is questionable if there is editing; but the footage is real. (11/30/2016)

Forward Progressives is a news and opinion website with a left bias in reporting. This source uses strong loaded words in headlines that are very sensationalized.The opinion pieces on this website are very far left politically; but yet reasonably sourced to validate opinions. News reporting also contains loaded language; but is almost always sourced to credible news and information. (5/13/2016) Updated (3/2/2017)

Gizmodois primarily a design; technology and science fiction website. However; they do occasionally report on politics; especially if it concerns technology. Politically; Gizmodo leans left in reporting. (11/19/2016)

Good Magazinewas started in 2006.The website receives about 10.1 M unique visitors to its website each month. The magazine covers a variety topics that are geared toward positive social and environmental change. The source has a clean fact check record; but it has a left bias in reporting and story selection. (12/9/2016)

GOPOCALYPSE is a far left news and opinion website. They use very strong loaded words and sensational headlines that serve as clickbait. Articles are not always sourced properly or are sourced to other left wing sources. This source only reports from one side. The left side. (3/3/2017)

GQ (formerly Gentlemens Quarterly) is an international monthly mens magazine based in New York City. The publication focuses on fashion; style; and culture for men; though articles on food; movies; fitness; sex; music; travel; sports; technology; booksand politics are also featured. GQ has a left wing political bias in reporting; but they generally are factual and source their information. Has been accused of sexism. (12/13/2016)

This website collects and repackages news stories with a liberal bias. Many headlines are sensationalized and use loaded words. They typically only cover one side of the story; but they do source to mostly credible information. (8/17/2016)

Groopspeak is a news and opinion website with astrong left wing bias. Many stories are overly sensationalized with misleading headlines. Groopspeak has had a mostlyfalse claim from Snopes.This source promotes propaganda. (12/19/2016)

Guardian Liberty Voice is a news and opinion website thathas a left bias in story selection that favors liberal causes. They use minimal loaded words and typically source to credible information. (8/10/2016)

The Huffington Post is an American online news aggregator and blog that has both localized and international editions founded by Arianna Huffington; Kenneth Lerer; Andrew Breitbart; and Jonah Peretti. Huffington Post displays left wing bias through story selection and word choices. Not evidence based on some scientific issues; but generally well sourced overall. (5/13/2016)

Inequality Mediaproduces original film and video; share theircontent through social media and media outlets to raise awareness about the issues; and partner with leading organizations to provide an avenue through which viewers can engage; mobilize; and take action against inequality. Inequality Media has a left wing political bias; but produces videos that are well sourced and factual. (12/15/2016)

In These Times is an American politically progressive/democratic socialist monthly magazine of news and opinion published by the Institute for Public Affairs in Chicago; Illinois. This is a very solid source for well written factual stories. (5/13/2016)

Jacobin is a left-wing quarterly magazine based in New York. It claims to bea leading voice of the American left; offering socialist perspectives on politics; economics; and culture. It isbiased in reporting; but very well written and sourced.

Jezebel is not really a political news source. It is more opinion based that is focused on entertainment news. Jezebel isbiased in favor of liberal causes through story choices and wording. (7/27/2016)

Lavender is a biweekly magazine; part of Lavender Media; published in Minneapolis; Minnesota for the gay; lesbian; bisexual; and transgender community. Lavender has a liberal political affiliation through story choices and is well sourced.

Left Action is a network of over 1;000;000 activists committed to making a difference and fighting for progressive causes. Sporadically provides news that is mostly factual with left bias in wording and reporting.

Left Foot Forward (LFF) is a left wing political blog in the UK; established in 2009.It regards as sister blogs ThinkProgress in the United States; and Chifley in Australia. LFF has a left bias in reporting choices and wording. Most articles are sourced properly and for the most part are factual.

Left Over Rights is a news and opinion blog with a left wing bias in reporting. Many headlines contain loaded words as do the articles themselves. Most stories are sourced to credible information; however some are pure speculation such as discussing the Presidents health problems; for which there is not evidence. Based on this we give a mixed factual reporting rating.

LeftScoop is a news and opinion website with a borderline extreme left bias in reporting. Virtually every headline utilizes sensational loaded words that induce clicking (Clickbait). The content of articles; however; are typically sourced to credible mainstream media sources; with LeftScoop writers providing opinion about the news story. This opinion is always pro-left and anti-right. Although they source to credible information and we cannot find any instances of failed fact checks; we still rate them mixed for factual reporting based on strong opinions that can be distracting and misleading from the facts.

Left Side of History is essentially a strong left leaning opinion blog. According to the website; Left Side of History describes itself as a new blog intelligently reporting and analyzing current events through a leftist lens. We are trying to combat the digitalmedia trends of clickbait and unsubstantiated; misleading news with nosubstance. The stories are all biased in favor of the left; which they make clear in the description. There is minimal use of loaded words and most entries are sourced to reasonable media. We give this source a mixed rating for factual reporting due to it being mostly opinion based.

LGBTQ Nation is an online news magazine; reporting on issues relevant to the lesbian; gay; bisexual; transgender; queer community. LGBTQ Nation is factually sourced and uses minimal loaded words. Has a strong left wing political affiliation through story choices and advocacy. (2/9/2017)

Liberal America claims to be the only place on the web that is devoted solely to all things liberal. This is a very fair claim and is accurate. Most headlines are sensationalized and the content of articles contains loaded emotional words. Liberal America sources where they are getting information from; but many times it is from other left wing or questionable sources. Therefore; we assign a mixed factual rating. (11/18/2016)
Liberals Unite is a well established very liberally biased news and opinion website. Liberals Unite has a strong left wing bias through reporting and word choices. (10/30/2016)

Liberation News is a socialist print newspaper that appears irregularly as well as awebsite that delivers news.Liberation News calls for a socialist revolution in North America and the world to end the dictatorial power of the wealthy; for a redistribution of the wealth; and for a planned economy run to meet human and environmental needs. Liberation news has a left wing socialist political bias in reporting and affiliation; however most content is well sourced to reliable media outlets. (5/5/2017)

Little Green Footballs (LGF) is an American political blog run by web designer Charles Johnson. In its beginning years; the site had a right-wing orientation and known for its advocacy of the War on Terrorism and the Iraq War; as well its strident criticism of political Islam. The blog moved away from the right around 2009. Currently; the blog has a left-wing bias in reporting and story choices. They also occasionally publish unverified stories such as this one.
Mashable is a news and opinion site that focuses mostly on social media and technology. When covering political issues they have a left bias in story selection.

Mean Left Hook is an unashamedly left bias site heavily loaded the most sensationalistic and confrontational rhetoric of the left. The articles; if they can honestly be called articles in the usual sense; are little more than the type of rants against the right you would find on a Facebook page. Mean Left Hook does in fact have a FB page which is primarily links to their articles sprinkled with pro left cartoons and memes.

Mediaite is a liberal news and opinion blog covering politics and entertainment in the media industry. It is the flagship blog of Abrams Media; a ring of blogs run by ABC legal analyst Dan Abrams. Mediaite presents news with aleft wing bias in reporting choices. Although they publish mostly stories that favor the left; they do source their content well. (8/21/2016) Updated (5/12/2017)

Media Matters for America is a politically progressive media watchdog in the United States. The organization has a stated mission of comprehensively monitoring; analyzing; and correcting conservative misinformation in the U.S. media.Set up as a tax-exempt; nonprofit organization; MMfA was founded in 2004 by journalist and political activist David Brock as a counterweight to the conservative Media Research Center.It is known for its aggressive criticism of conservative journalists and media outlets; including its War on Fox News. According to Politifact Media Matters has been factual in reporting. (5/13/2016) Updated (4/24/2017)

Merry Jane is a website all about Marijuana (Cannabis). It provides news on marijuana legislation and lifestyle. It has a left wing political bias in reporting and political affiliation. All articles are well sourced and factual. This is a solid resource for all things cannabis.

Miami New Times (MNT) is the online version of the local newspaper of the same name. Most of the sites content is; as one would expect; Miami specific. It does carry some political content; however; and it is on that content alone that MNT is rated. The political stories are factual and sourced well enough; but the information is presented and weighted with a decidedly left slant. (D. Kelley)

The Middle East Monitor (MEMO) is a not-for-profitpress monitoring organization; founded on 1 July 2009.MEMO is largely focused on the IsraeliPalestinian conflict but writes about other issues in the Middle East as well. According to Ehud Rosen; MEMO generally supports Islamist positions within Palestinian politics.According to Andrew Gilligan; the Middle East Monitor promotes a strongly pro-Muslim Brotherhood and pro-Hamas viewpoint. Anshel Pfeffer described MEMO as a conspiracy theory-peddling anti-Israel organisation. Our review shows that the Middle East Monitor has a left wing bias in the use of loaded words and also in story choices that promote Islamic positions.We could not find any instances of the Middle East Monitor failing fact checks; but they do sometimes source to questionable media outlets and hence garner a Mixed factual rating. (D. Van Zandt)

Modern Liberals is a website dedicated to liberal news. This source presents news and opinions with a left wing bias in reporting choices and the use of emotive words. Modern Liberals also publishes satire and fake news that is clearly labeled as such. They currently have a questionable article up claiming several news sources to be fake. While some on this list are questionable and some just biased like the Palmer Report and Breitbart; none of them are fake news and usually have information rooted in fact. Modern Liberals is on the borderline of being a questionable website and will be monitored.

Mondoweissis a news website that is co-edited by journalists Philip Weiss and Adam Horowitz. It is a part of the Center for Economic Research and Social Change. According to the editors; Mondoweiss is a news website devoted to covering American foreign policy in the Middle East; chiefly from a progressive Jewish perspective. Its founder describes himself as progressive and anti-Zionist. Overall; Mondoweiss is well sourced and factual. Headlines generally match the content of articles and loaded words are at a minimum. This source has a left wing bias in reporting and through its support of Palestine and general liberal causes. (3/4/2017)

Mother Jonesis a politically progressive American magazine reporting on politics; the environment; human rights; and culture. Mother Jones is published by the Foundation for National Progress (FNP); a nonprofit 501(c)(3) organization. Mother Jones has been a finalist for 31 National Magazine Awards; winning seven times. Mother Jones provides in depth journalism that mostlyfavors the political left. We cannot find any evidence of Mother Jones making false claims and when in error they correct appropriately. This is a factual source that is always well sourced. (5/13/2016) Updated (4/25/2017)

MoveOn.org is an American; non-profit; progressive public policy advocacy group and political action committee.Formed in 1998 in response to the impeachment of President Bill Clinton by the U.S. House of Representatives; MoveOn.org has raised millions of dollars for candidates it identifies as progressives in the United States. Strong left wing bias with reporting and has an unproven claim according to Snopes.

Ms. is an American liberal feminist magazine co-founded by second-wave feminists and sociopolitical activists Gloria Steinem and Dorothy Pitman Hughes. Ms. occasionally uses loaded words in headlines and articles. They typically report factually with backing sources. We rate them left biased based on political ideology and affiliation through there promotion of feminism.

Nap-Sack bills itself as an alternative social media site open to the world at large to voice their opinions on anything; social and political issues; science; spiritualism; etc. In this it largely succeeds as there are numerous options for visitors to start petitions; comment on the blogs and start or join discussion groups. The blogs on the site were a mixed bag; running the gamut from left bias political commentary; to UFOs; to spirituality. Other than the blog commentary; Nap-Sack is a-political as it encourages visitors to speak their mind regardless of their political and social views. They also offer links to a variety of news sources from Russia Today to Reuters. Nap-Sack; as it is a social media site and doesnt pretend to be anything else; does not easily fit in any of the usual MBFC categories. It is Pro-Science in some regards; Conspiracy-Pseudoscience in others; and somewhat Questionable as well. It earned a Left Bias strictly from the political content of the blogs. While I wouldnt recommend Nap-Sack as a news source I do applaud their effort to provide an open forum for the world to speak out. (D. Kelley)

Nation of Change is a 501(c) nonprofit news and activism organization founded in 2011 and based out of Albuquerque; New Mexico. Nation of Change provides a free daily newsletter with articles from progressive writers and initiates activist calls to action. Nation of Change does not always support the consensus of science. (5/13/2016) Updated (2/24/2017)

Established in 1973. New Internationalist (NI) is an independent; non-profit; publishing co-operative; based in Oxford; United Kingdom. Predominantly known for its monthly independent magazine; it describes itself as existing to cover stories the mainstream media sidestep and provide alternative perspectives on todays global critical issues. New Internationalist presents news with a moderate left wing bias throughreporting choices. NI always sources to credible information. (5/13/2016) Updated (4/25/2017)

New Politics is an independent socialist journal founded in 1961.While it is inclusive of articles from a variety of left-of-center positions; the publication leans strongly toward a democratic Marxist perspective; placing it typically to the left of the liberal or social democratic views. Strong journalism and factually sourced. (8/17/2016)

The New Republic is a liberal American magazine of commentary on politics and the arts published since 1914; with major influence on American political and cultural thinking. Founded in 1914 by major leaders of the Progressive Movement it attempted to find a balance between a progressivism focused on humanitarianism and moral passion; and on the other hand sought a basis in scientific analysis of social issues. New Republic has produced quality journalism for over a century.

The New Statesman is a British political and cultural magazine published in London. Founded as a weekly review of politics and literature on 12 April 1913; it was connected then with Sidney and Beatrice Webb and other leading members of the socialist Fabian Society. The magazine has; according to its present self-description; a left-of-centre political position. By USA standards this source is considered left biased based on story selection and wording. They are always well sourced and factual. (5/13/2016)

Established in 1968. New York is a bi-weekly magazine concerned with life; culture; politics; and style generally; and with a particular emphasis on New York City. NY Mag has a left wing bias in story selection and reporting; but is always sourced and factual. (5/13/2016)
Observer (OB) is an online publication primarily serving New York city. This review centers specifically on OBs National and International reporting.

The New Yorker is an American magazine of reportage; commentary; criticism; essays; fiction; satire; cartoons; and poetry. It is published by Cond Nast. Started as a weekly in 1925; the magazine is now published 47 times annually; with five of these issues covering two-week spans. The New York is trustworthy for factual accuracy; but with a left wing bias in wording and report choices. (5/13/2016)

News Corpses mission is to expose corporate media. They embrace independent media; but with a left wing bias in reporting and wording. For example; there is significant use of loaded words in headlines; such as: Trump Whines Because Democrats Are Smiling  No; Theyre Laughing at You; Loser. Due to a very strong bias it is recommended to fact check this source. This is a borderline questionable source. (10/14/2016) Updated (3/29/2017)
A website dedicated to exposing Fox News in lies and misreporting. Has a left wing bias and sometimes takes information out of context.

Newslogue is highly biased towards liberal and progressive views. The articles are worded and weighted very heavily towards the left and read more like op-eds instead of news articles. The articles are penned primarily by Caitlin Johnson; and the site appears more like a personal blog than a news site. As such; the articles arent always entirely factual either. Example; in their article The Right Has No Answer For Automation Job Loss; But The Left Does the author maintains that the right is against a Universal Basic Income. Even a simple search reveals that there is indeed bipartisan support for it. (D. Kelley)

NowThis News was founded by Huffington Post co-founder and former chairman Kenneth Lerer and former Huffington Post CEO Eric Hippeau. Uses Facebook; Snapchat; Twitter; Instagram; Vine; Tumblr; and YouTube as primary outlets. Political news reports have a strong liberal/progressive leaning bias; heavily relying on meme culture and soundbites; often omitting certain key facts spoken in videos clips.

OpEdNews is an open progressive forum for opinion and news. Because each individual author is wholly responsible for the content she or he submits; veracity varies with the individual writer and its entirely up to readers to assess journalistic quality and bias. There is no firewall between biased opinion and well-sourced analytical reporting. Volunteer editors moderate the posts for bad taste and seek to discourage libelous and slanderous content. Posts the editors like get headlined on the front page. Frequent contributors may earn the trust of the publisher and bypass editor pre-screening to post directly. Spirited and thought-provoking discussions often follow articles as comments. (R. Shreve)

Paste is a monthly music and entertainment digital magazine published in the United States by Wolfgangs Vault. Its tagline is Signs of Life in Music; Film and Culture.It ran as a print publication from 2002 to 2010 before converting to online-only. While Paste Magazine is primarily a Music and entertainment magazine it does have a political section with typical left wing bias. It utilizes strong loaded words that are pro-liberal and anti-conservative. The source is factual in reporting on political news; but has a left wing editorial position.

People is an American weekly magazine of celebrity and human-interest stories; published by Time Inc. With a readership of 46.6 million adults; People has the largest audience of any American magazine. The online version of People Magazine has a politics section that has a moderate left wing bias through wording and story selection.

Photography is Not a Crime; abbreviated to PINAC and published under the trade names PINAC News; is an organization and news website that focuses on rights of civilians who photograph and film police misconduct and other similar activities in the United States incorporated in June 2014 as PINAC Inc. a Florida not for profit corporation. It was founded in 2007 following the arrest of its creator; Carlos Miller; a veteran news reporter and photojournalist.PINAC focuses on First Amendment issues that intersect with governmental oppression of those rights; normally by police officers. It also gives civilians tips on how to interact with the police and assert their constitutionally protected rights. This source uses loaded words in their headlines; but they source their information well. (11/29/2016)

Pink News is a UK-based online newspaper marketed to the lesbian; gay; bisexual and transgender community (LGBT). They have a left wing opinionbias; however their reporting is strong and mostly evidence based. (11/12/2016)

Political Updater is a news and opinion website that reports with loaded words and not always well sourced information. While the site does seem to report both left and right stories there ismore that favor the left in our sampling. (8/15/2016)

PoliticusUsa is a left wing biased news and opinion website. PoliticusUsa typically sources to credible media sourcessuch as Reutersandare factual in reporting as we were unable to find any instances of failed fact checks. Though headlines tend to be somewhat sensational; the content of articles is evidence based with occasional use of loaded words that convey emotion. In short; PoliticusUsa is left biased through story choicesand wording; but factual in reporting. (5/15/2016)
Pravda Reports is a far left communist newspaper from Russia. It does not always report accurately about USA and other international news. (7/30/2016)

Press Progress; an online news and analysis website; is a project of the Broadbent Institute which seeks to provide an online Progressive Political news source. Press Progress has a left bias in reporting stories and uses moderately loaded word choices. They do however; link to mostly credible sources. (2/18/2017)

I am pretty sure you have gathered the bias by the name alone. There is a very strong left wing bias here. They occasionally produce good content; butthey also fail to source sometimes to quality sources.

Rabble.ca is an non-profit alternative Canadian online magazine founded in 2001.Rabble.ca works in partnership with the Canadian Centre for Policy Alternatives and the Centre for Social Justice. It features podcasts; videos and an discussion board called babble. Rabble uses a lot of loaded language in the headlines; and within the articles. Mostly in commentaries they describe themselves as blurring the line between readers and contributors; providing a space for issues exploring political passions and an opportunity to expand ideas. They are an openly progressive site; reporting and commenting on current news with a clear left bias. (F. Locke Siewert 2/11/2017)

Rappler is an online news site based in the Philippines with a bureau in Jakarta; Indonesia.One of the distinguishing features of Rappler is its Mood Meter consisting of bubbles showing the way people react to certain news.The Mood Meter is embedded on each story. Users are asked how does this story make you feel? and are given 8 different emotions to choose from  happy; sad; angry; afraid; annoyed; inspired; amused and dont care. The top ten stories with the most votes over a 48-hour period appear on the Mood Navigator. Rappler has left wing bias in reporting news from the Philippines. They are fiercely opposed to President Duterte and his anti-drug campaign where he advocates killingdrug users. We give a mixed factual reporting rating based on some disputes regarding claims made by Rappler. When reporting international news Rappler is relatively low biased and straightforward. (5/16/2017)

Raw Progressiveis a news and opinion website with a borderline extreme left bias in reporting. Virtually every headline utilizes sensational loaded words that induce clicking (Clickbait). The content of articles; are typically sourced to far left sources such as LeftScoop. Raw Progressive typically takes a news story and interjects left biased opinions around the story.The opinion is always pro-left and anti-right. Although we could notfind any instances of failed fact checks; we still rate them mixed for factual reporting based on strong opinions that can be distracting and misleading from the facts. This source also does not have an About page or any other author information; which reduces credibility.

The Raw Story is an American online news organization founded in 2004 by John Byrne. It covers current national and international political and economic news and publishes its own editorials and investigative pieces. The Raw Story describes itself as progressive; bringing attention to stories that it sees as downplayed or ignored by other media outlets. Raw Story demonstrates left wing bias in reporting and story selection.Raw Story has a Half-True claim with Politifact and an Unproven claim with Snopes. (5/15/2016)
Red Pepper is an independent radical red and green magazine based in the UK. Has strong socialist biases; but is well sourced.

Rewire is a website focused on reproductive and sexual health from a pro-reproductive rights perspective.The website began as a UN Foundation blog in 2006; and became its own nonprofit organization in January 2012. Although the site has a left wing political perspective it does offer mostly evidence based information. (10/17/2016)

Revcom.us is the voice of the Revolutionary Communist Party of the USA. With that said is has a strong Communist bias. It uses strong loaded words to describe other political parties. The sole purpose of the site is to promote Communism.
Revolution News is a news and opinion website featuring independent journalists. Published stories typically have a moderate left wing bias and are usually sourced properly.

Right Wing Watch keeps track of a variety of organizations; but the groups they track do tend to be conservative extremist in one regard or another. This source does occasionally take statements out of context. Needs to be fact checked. (5/15/2016)

Ring of Fire is a nationally syndicated American talk radio program that has Overt left wing bias. Each host has their own style and level of bias; but most source reliable sources in their reporting. They do however; take many things out of context.

Salon is a progressive/liberal website created by David Talbot in 1995 and part of Salon Media Group. It focuses on U.S. politics and current affairs. Salon hashas left wing bias through reporting and wording; but can be trusted to source to mostly credible information. (5/15/2016)

Scary Mommy is a news and opinion website/blog that is geared toward parenting. They also cover news and politics with a left wing bias in reporting choices. There is minimal use of loaded words and all stories are factual and/or sourced properly.

Shareblue is an online political news source. It is affiliated with Blue Nation Review and David Brock. This source; like Blue Nation Review has a strongleft wing bias in story selection and wording. Shareblue also occasionally publishes stories that are propagandist and misleading factually.

Slate is an English-language online current affairs; politics and culture magazine in the United States that trends towards a liberalviewpoint through story choices and wording. Slate tends to source to credible information; but uses rather sensationalized headlines to increase clicks. (5/15/2016) Updated (2/24/2017)

Socialist Standard is a monthly socialist magazine published without interruption since September 1904 by the Socialist Party of Great Britain. The magazine is written in a simple; direct style and focuses mainly on socialist advocacy and Marxian analysis of current events; particularly those affecting the United Kingdom.

SourceWatchaims to produce a directory of public relations firms; think tanks; industry-funded organizations and industry-friendly experts that work to influence public opinion and public policy on behalf ofcorporations; governments and special interest groups (Wikipedia). SourceWatchs reporting always tends to favor liberals. They do however; source their content and are considered factual.

Chris Ernesto (born October 16; 1963) is a founding member of St. Pete for Peace;a non-partisan antiwar organization providing peace oriented education events and services to the Tampa Bay; FL community since 2003. He created and manages the StPeteForPeace.org; OccupyArrests.comand USinAfrica.comwebsites. Ernesto has also organized numerous demonstrations; published multiple articles and videos; and is a lead researcher for St. Pete for Peace where he has developed dozens of fact sheets. St. Pete for Peace has a left wing political bias; however; they do source well; although at times to other left wing sources. Otherwise; this is a pretty trustworthy source for anti-war information.

Talking Points Memo (or TPM) is a liberal web-based political journalism website created and run by Josh Marshall; a journalist; liberal bloggerand historian.It debuted on November 12; 2000.TPM has liberal bias in story selection andproduces some very credible journalism. They almost always source to credible information. (7/26/2016)

TakePart produces a Web site with a daily cycle of original articles; blogs; and videos on the culture and lifestyle of change. Topics of coverage include animals; arts; food; education; the environment; green tech; politics; culture; health and innovation.

La Nueva Televisora del Sur (teleSUR; English: The New Television Station of the South) is multi-state funded; panLatin American terrestrial and satellite television network sponsored by the governments of Venezuela; Cuba; Ecuador; Nicaragua; Uruguay; and Bolivia that is headquartered in Caracas; Venezuela. TeleSUR has been accused of being a propaganda tool forHugo Chavez and his successors. TeleSUR uses minimal loaded words; but has a very strong pro-Venezuela and anti-American bias in reporting. (1/5/2017)

The American Prospect is a quarterly American political magazine dedicated to American liberalism. Based in Washington; D.C.; The American Prospect says it aims to advance liberal and progressive goals through reporting; analysis; and debate about todays realities and tomorrows possibilities. The American Prospecthas a left wing bias in story selection and is always well sourced. (5/15/2016)

The Blue Route is a news and opinion website with strong left wing bias in reporting and emotional word use. They sometimes source to other far left sources and many articles are opinion based; hence we give a mixed factual rating. (7/26/2016)

The Canary is a left-wing political blog in the United Kingdom. The Canary uses strong loaded words with a left-wing bias. They are evidence based and provide sources for claims. They typically report only one side of the story and have a strong liberal political affiliation. (12/1/2016)

The Climate Reality Project; founded by Al Goreis a non-profit organization involved in education and advocacy related to climate change. The mission of the Climate Reality Project is to focus on climate change education and countering climate change denial campaigns worldwide. While TCRP is well sourced and factual in scientific information; it also has a left wing bias in its criticism of President Trump and Conservatives.We give this organization a moderate left bias rating based on story selection that opposes the conservative point of viewthat climate change is not human caused or simply not important. (3/23/2017)
The Daily Banter is an online news and opinion site. It produces well written articles that must be filtered through their liberal bias on most stories. Most information is sourced.

The Daily Buzz is a multimedia and news website that covers a variety of topics; including politics. The Daily Buzz features many humorous articles; but they also present straightforward news that is well sourced and factual. News reporting tends to have a left bias in story selection and somewhat sensationalized headlines. However; the content of these news articles are often well writtenand always link to credible sources.
The Daily Vox is a South African news and opinion website. They present news with slightly loaded words that have a left wing bias. Most articles are well sourced. (1/22/2017)

This is perhaps the easiest review ever done. From The Democratic Hubs about page: Our online community is for liberals; progressives; moderates; independent and anyone who has a favorable opinion of Democrats and/or liberal political views or is critical of Republican ideology. That really about sums it up. This source uses strong loaded words that favor Democrats and discredits Republicans. All content is written by member bloggers and is highly opinionated; which matches their appropriate description. At least they are honest in who they are.

The Frisky is a womens entertainment and lifestyle website which was launched in 2008. When covering political news they have a left wing bias with loaded words and story selection. Though biased they do source to credible information.

TheGrio is an American website with news; opinion; entertainment and video content geared toward African Americans.TheGrio is one of the largest news sources for black America. Originally launched in June 2009 as a division of NBC News;it became a division of MSNBC in 2013. Covers a lot of entertainment news; but also does cover politics with a left wing bias and typically sources properly.

The Intellectualist is a news aggregation website that primarily usesleft-center sources. Most sources are credible; however we rate the Intellectualist left biased because almost all stories are favorable to the left or damaging to the right. The Intellectualist is factual in sourcing; but biased based on story choices. (3/9/2017)

The Militant is an international Socialist newsweekly connected to the Socialist Workers Party (SWP) and the Pathfinder Press.It is published in the United States and distributed in other countries such as Canada; the United Kingdom; Australia; France; Sweden; Iceland; and New Zealand. Has a left wing socialist bias in reporting; but does not use loaded words and sources well.

Morning Star is a left-wing British daily tabloid newspaper with a focus on social; political and trade union issues. Articles and comment columns are contributed by writers from socialist; communist; social democratic; green and religious perspectives. Uses strong words with a liberal bias and has sensational headlines. Mostly links to credible sources. (5/15/2016) Updated (4/26/2017)

The Nation is the oldest continuously published weekly magazine in the United States; and the most widely read weekly journal of progressive political and cultural news; opinion and analysis. Founded in 1865; The Nation produces well written journalism that is factual and well sourced. They demonstrate left wing bias in story choices and wording. (5/15/2016) Updated (4/26/2017)

The National Memo is an American online news site and newsletter. Founded in 2011 by award-winning journalist and editor Joe Conason; features daily breaking news and commentary as well as analysis from Americas top progressive thinkers.With a focus on American politics; The National Memo also covers world news and events; consumer finance; health; travel and entertainment. The National Memo is always well sourced and factual; but the bias clearly favors the left in almost every story. This is a solid source for credible information; but on a whole this source does not always cover both sides of the story.
The New Civil Rights Movement is a website news source that promotes civil rights for LGBT people. They use strong left biased language regarding conservatives and have an unproven claim from Snopes.

The Other 98% is a non-profit activist group that are tired of corporate control of our government; our institutions; and our planet. Their primary mission is to get money out of politics and reduce corporate influence. They present information with a left wing bias regarding reporting and wording. They also have a mixed file from Politifact.

The Progressive is an American monthly magazine of politics; culture and progressivism with a pronounced liberal perspective. Founded in 1909 by Senator Robert Fighting Bob La Follette; it was originally called La Follettes Weekly and then simply La Follettes.In 1929; it was recapitalized and had its name changed to The Progressive (Wikipedia). The Progressive has a left wing bias in story selection. They source all stories to credible information.

The Root is an English-language American online magazine of African-American culture launched on January 28; 2008; by Henry Louis Gates; Jr. and Donald E. Graham; and was owned by Graham Holdings Company (Wikipedia). Solid evidence based reporting with a left wing bias in wording and political affiliation.

The Village Voice was created in 1955 as a platform for the creative community. As the nations first alternative newsweekly; The Village Voice introduced free-form; high-spirited; and passionate journalism into the public discourse. The recipient of three Pulitzer Prizes; the National Press Foundation Award and the George Polk Award; The Village Voice remains a go-to source for coverage of New Yorks politics and vast cultural landscape. The Village Voice produces high quality journalism and sources political information well. It does however have a left wing bias in what it reports and the use of emotional (loaded) words.

The Walrus is a Canadian general interest magazine which publishes long-form journalism on Canadian and international affairs; along with fiction and poetry by Canadian writers . The Walrus produces high quality liberal journalism that is factually sourced.

ThinkProgress is an American political news blog. It is a project of the Center for American Progress; a progressive public policy research and advocacy organization. Has a left wing bias in story selection and has failed some fact checks including these from Snopes. (5/15/2016) Updated (2/24/2017)
This Magazine is an independent alternative Canadian political magazine. Has a left wing bias in story selection and is usually factually sourced.

Towleroad is blog founded by Andy Towleand isbased in New York City. Towle; who is gay; started his blog Towleroad in 2003.The blog focuses on gays; pop culture; photography; politics; media; entertainment; technology; and travel. Towleroad uses strong loaded language with a far left bias in reporting. Most articles are sourced reasonable well; but their is significant opinion interjected into each article.

Tribune is a democratic socialist fortnightly newspaper; founded in 1937 and published in London. It has always been independent but has usually supported the Labour Party from the left. Has a left wing political bias; but is well sourced to credible information.

Truthdig is a news website that provides a mix of long-form articles; interviews; and blog-like commentary on current events; delivered from a politically progressivepoint of view. Truthdig has a left wing bias in what they choose to report and the words they use; but the articles are generally well written and reasonably sourced. (11/18/2016)

Truthout is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit; progressive news organization in the United States that operates a web site and distributes a daily newsletter. Registered in September 2001; in Sacramento; California; Truthout publishes original political news articles; opinion pieces; video reports and artwork. According to its web site; Truthout works to broaden and diversify the political discussion by introducing independent voices and focusing on under covered issues and unconventional thinking. Truthout has a strong left wing bias in reporting choices and wording. They also have reported some stories that were not factual. For example; a reporter claimed that Karl Rove was indicted on charges when in fact he wasnt. The reporter continued to make the claim without evidence. See link here. Although this is only one example it shows that this source should be checked when in doubt. (5/15/2016) Updated (4/26/2017)

Uproxx is an American digital media company that covers entertainment and culture. It was founded in 2008 by Jarret Myer and Brian Brater and acquired by Woven Digital in 2014. The sites target audience is males aged 18-34. Uproxx has a left wing political affiliation in reporting. They are generally factual and source to credible information. (10/3/2016)

Upworthy is a website for viral content started in March 2012 by Eli Pariser; the former executive director of MoveOn; and Peter Koechley; the former managing editor of The Onion.It uses virality to promote stories with a progressive bent on political and social issues. Upworthy claims to fact check every post; we couldnt find anything to dispute this. They do however have a left wing bias in story selection. (5/15/2016) Updated (6/2/2017)
US Politcal Post is a News and Opinion blog with left wing bias in reporting. As of 12/22/16 this source does not appear to be active any longer.

US Uncut has overt left wing bias in story selection and wording. Does not have an about or mission page to explain its positions. Does not provide biographies for its writers. Not all articles are well sourced and are highly sensationalized. Requires fact checking against reliable sources. (5/15/2016)

Vanity Fair is a magazine of popular culture; fashion; and current affairs published by Cond Nast (Wikipedia). Vanity Fair also publishes political content that has a moderate left wing bias. This is seen in several articles critical of conservatives and positive in favor of more liberal politicians. Overall; Vanity Fair is well written and mostly factual; but there is a clear left wing bias.

Vote is a news and opinion blog with a left wing bias in reporting. Most articles favor liberals and oppose conservatives. There is some use of loaded words; which is to be expected from a mostly opinion based website. Due to this source writing mostly opinion pieces we rate it mixed for factual reporting as sourcing is limited. (6/3/2017)

Vox is an American advocacy news website run by Vox Media; co-founded by liberal columnists Ezra Klein; Melissa Bell; and Matt Yglesias and launched in April 2014. Vox presents with left wing bias in reporting and story choices. There is some use of loaded words; but most articles are sourced to credible information. (5/15/2016)
Washington Monthly is a bimonthly nonprofit magazine of United States politics and government that is based in Washington; D.C.Has a liberal bias in reporting and word choices.

Wonkette is a news and opinion website with a very strong liberal bias. They sometimes post tongue in cheek articles that can be misleading. Overall; they source their information and will correct factual errors when they occur. Although they are very biased in their wording and content they are reliable for information. (5/15/2016) Updated (3/10/2017)

The Young Turks (TYT) is an American political commentary web series that was created by journalist Cenk Uygur; Ben Mankiewicz and Dave Koller. Currently co-hosted by Uygur and Ana Kasparian; its stance isprogressive/left-wing; although its primary focus is on political commentary; the program provides opinion on topics of varying news genres. Although very left biased in delivery the Young Turks do a decentjob of sourcing their information with credibility.

Z Magazine was established in 1987.It is published in print and on-line. Contributors to the magazine include Noam Chomsky;Edward S. Herman;Mike Kuhlenbeck;Jack Rasmas;Paul Streetand Kevin Zeese. Has a distinct Libertarian-Socialist-Anarchist Bias.

ABC News is the news division of the American Broadcasting Company (ABC); owned by the Disney Media Networks division of The Walt Disney Company. Like most so called Mainstream media sources ABC has been accused of liberal bias. In reality; ABC is mostly trustworthy with a left of center bias. (5/15/2016)

Above the Law (often abbreviated ATL) is a news website about law; law schools; and the legal profession.Established in 2006; the site is owned and published by Breaking Media. Uses minimal loaded words; is sourced and factual in reporting. Story selection has a left-center bias. (1/31/2017)

Aeon is a digital magazine of ideas and culture. Publishing new articles every weekday; Aeon describes itself as a publication which asks the biggest questions and finds the freshest; most original answers; provided by world-leading authorities on science; philosophy and society. They also covers news and politics with a slight left-center bias in reporting choices; is factually sourced and uses minimal emotional wording. (D. Van Zandt 2/18/2017)

Al Jazeera is a Doha-based state-funded broadcaster owned by the Al Jazeera Media Network; which is partly funded by the House of Thani; the ruling family of Qatar.Initially launched as an Arabic news and current affairs satellite TV channel; Al Jazeera has since expanded into a network with several outlets; including the Internet and specialty TV channels in multiple languages. Al Jazeera is among the largest news organizations with 80 bureaus around the world. Al Jazeera is owned by the government of Qatar and has pro-Qatari bias. However; Al Jazeera uses low bias whenreporting USA news and often sources to credible information. (5/15/2016) Updated (6/25/2017)

Al-Monitor is a media site launched in February 2012 by the Arab American entrepreneur Jamal Danieland based in Washington; DC. Al-Monitor provides reporting and analysis from and about the Middle East through both original and translated content. Al Monitor is well sourced; credible and factual. Has a left of center bias politically. (5/15/2016) Updated (6/25/2017)

Is a leading research and policy organization committed to advancing sexual and reproductive health and rights in the United States. Left of Center politically; but excellent sourcing and factual information. (5/15/2016) Updated (1/12/2017)

The Alaska Dispatch News is a daily newspaper published by the Alaska Dispatch; and based in Anchorage; Alaska.The newspaper has won the Pulitzer Prize twice in the Public Service category; in 1976 and 1989.The Alaska Dispatch News is factual in reporting and has a left-center editorial bias. (8/12/2016)

The AlbanyTimes Union is an American daily newspaper; serving the Capital Region of New York; United States. Although the newspaper focuses on Albany and its suburbs; it covers all parts of the four-county area; including the cities of Troy; Schenectady and Saratoga Springs. (10/6/2016)

The Akron Beacon Journal is a morning newspaper in Ohio; United States; and published by Black Press. It is the sole daily newspaper in Akron and is distributed throughout Northeast Ohio. The paper places a strong emphasis on local news and business. (10/7/2016)
AM New York is a morning free daily newspaper that is published in New York City by Newsday. AM New York has a left center reporting bias; but is well sourced and factual in reporting. (3/16/2017)

America is a national weekly magazine published by the Jesuits of the United States and headquartered in midtown Manhattan. It contains news and opinion about Roman Catholicism and how it relates to American politics and cultural life. Published continuously since 1909; it is one of the oldest periodicals in the U.S. America is well sourced and factual. They use minimal loaded words in headlines and articles. While they do take somewhat conservative Catholic positions from an editorial standpoint; their reporting of news has a slight left center bias through favoring more liberal causes such as income equality and environmental protection. This is a reliable source. (D. Van Zandt 4/13/2017)

The American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) is a nonpartisan; non-profit; organization whose stated mission is to defend and preserve the individual rights and liberties guaranteed to every person in this country by the Constitution and laws of the United States.It works through litigation; lobbying; and community empowerment. The ACLU in their blog section and even news section often cite to places like the Huffington Post for news articles but sometimes they will usebasic reporting like AP or Reuters. Beyond their news and blog posts most of the site covers issues that are often considered more liberal causes but most often it is consistent with theirstance on the rights they champion. TheACLU has defended the KKK; Pro Abortion; and Neo-Nazis right to assemble and protest (1 2 3). They will often be accused of being left biased as they do not advocate for gun rights; however they equally do not champion gun regulations either. A quick search for Gun Rights or even Guns will yield no results or results only related to search and seizure cases they have taken on. They do not agree on the individuals rights to own firearms but do not advocate on their beliefs. They have teamed up with the NRA several times in a sort of odd fellowship (4). Their Blog & News feeds can often be filled with more left leaning stances; but they are not biased in their case work load or defending the rights they advocate for. There have been times Justice Scalia the most outspoken and most conservative justice at the time had ideas that line up with the ACLU (5). Most modern conservatives may often take issue with much of what the ACLU advocates and litigates in courts. However; the ACLU has defended religious freedoms in the school as well. Including the right to pray in school (6). I would try to advocate that the ACLU is more neutral than left; but with the major shift in American politics to the right; I can no longer advocate that stance. (M. Allen 2/9/2017)

The American Herald Tribune is an online independent news source. The American Herald Tribune produces quality journalism that is factually based. Has a left-center bias in content and reporting. (11/26/2016)

The Anti-Defamation League is an international Jewish non-governmental organization based in the United States. Describing itself as the nations premier civil rights/human relations agency; the ADL states that it fights anti-Semitism and all forms of bigotry; defends democratic ideals and protects civil rights for all; doing so through information; education; legislation; and advocacy. Has been accused of having a liberal political bias. (10/6/2016)

AOL is an online magazine featuring a variety of content; from politics to lifestyle to video games. While they dont carry a lot of political content; what they do carry is factual; well sourced and delivered with minimal bias. Despite a very slight left slant it is still well within the Least Biased category. (D. Kelley 3/3/2017)
ARA News is a Syrian independent press agency concerned with covering local developments across Syria; including its Kurdish region. (8/30/2016)

The Arizona Daily Star is the major morning daily newspaper that serves Tucson and surrounding districts of southern Arizona in the United States. They report news factually and with sources. Has a left-center editorial bias. (7/30/2016)
The Asheville Citizen-Times is a major daily newspaper from Asheville; North Carolina. Is well sourced with just a slight left of center bias in news coverage. (10/7/2016)

The Atlanta Journal-Constitution (AJC) is the only major daily newspaper in the metropolitan area of Atlanta; Georgia; United States. The AJC is factual and sourced in reporting with a left of center editorial stance. (5/15/2016)

The Atlantic is an American magazine; founded in 1857 as The Atlantic Monthly in Boston; Massachusetts. Since 2006; the magazine is based in Washington; D.C.Created as a literary and cultural commentary magazine; it has grown to achieve a national reputation as a high-quality review organ with a moderate worldview.The periodical has won more National Magazine Awards than any other monthly magazine. Has a slightly liberal bias in reporting coverage; put produces exceptional journalism that is sourced and factual. (5/15/2016)

Atlantic Media owns the following sources:www.govexec.com; www.nextgov.com; www.routefifty.com; qz.com; www.nationaljournal.com; www.theatlantic.com; www.citylab.com; www.defenseone.com. They borrow writers and share stories depending on the contact they are going with. For example; an article on www.defenseone.com uses an article from www.nextgov.com the writer is Joseph Marks  who covers cybersecurity for Nextgov. He previously covered cybersecurity for Politico.The sites all seem to have particular themes they focus on. Government; military; cyber; city; etc. Atlantic Media is the main company and keeps all these brands under that umbrella sharing writers and sources. Overall they are well sourced; truth filled; andlean slightly left. (M. Allen 5/13/2017)

ATTN is a political and social site geared towards millennials; although not exclusively so. Founded by Matthew Segal; a political activist and commentator who writes for the Huffington Post and is also a frequent commentator on MSNBC. While Mr. Segals politics are unashamedly left leaning; the content of ATTN is factual and well sourced. The political tone of the articles is mixed; running from Left Bias to Least Biased. While this reflects the individual authors opinions more than any specific editorial stance this slight lack of focus in overall content is what prevented ATTN from receiving a Least Biased rating. Additionally; ATTN does cite itself occasionally in its other articles; which I find a bit self serving when any news site does it. Even if the content cited is factual. While again; this may reflect the individual authors rather than editorial intent; its easy enough to use external sources instead.
